summary:
I'm a legal professional with a diverse background and a knack for negotiation. With over 6 years of experience in commercial contract negotiation, legal research, and drafting, I've had the privilege of assisting companies worldwide in navigating  compliance matters and sealing the deal. From the United States to Canada, the United Kingdom to Brazil, and even places like Afghanistan, China, and Pakistan, I've worked with clients and organizations from all corners of the globe.

I currently hold the position of Head of Legal at Foleon, where I lead the company's legal strategy and provide invaluable guidance to support our business growth. It's a role I take great pride in, as I work closely with the executive team and the CFO to ensure that our legal endeavors align with our commercial objectives.

My educational journey has taken me on an exciting path. I earned my qualifying law degree from the esteemed University of London and completed an Advanced LL.M in International Civil and Commercial Law from Leiden University. In fact, my thesis focused on how different countries, including the Netherlands, Pakistan, and the UK, handle unforeseen changes of circumstances and force majeure in commercial contracts, using COVID-19 as a prime example.

Throughout my career, I've honed my skills in research, drafting, and communication, while deepening my knowledge of various legal systems. My competencies include contract law, legal research, crafting rock-solid legal agreements, corporate law, commercial law, and international law. It's this well-rounded expertise that allows me to bring valuable insights and solutions to the table.

education.field_of_study: International Civil and Commercial Law (Advanced programme)

awards.title: Academic Achievement Award
awards.description: For recognition for scoring a high distinction on my dissertation.

awards.title: Advocacy Training Programme
awards.description: Achievement of a certificate upon completion of the course, whereby I was required to practice presenting applications before the court and in turn, sharpen my advocacy skills.

profile_positions.description:
As the Head of Legal at Foleon, I am responsible for leading the company's overarching legal strategy and providing legal solutions to support our business growth. Reporting directly to the CFO, I collaborate closely with the executive leadership team to advise on legal matters and ensure compliance with relevant statutory regulations. My main responsibilities revolve around sales and procurement contract management, negotiating contracts, and maintaining contract templates and terms while balancing legal risks and financial exposure. I also oversee a contract management team, training and supporting them on contract management skills and Foleon's best practices and quality standards.
Responsibilities:

•	Manage customer contracting for our EMEA and US operations, including redlining, negotiations, and collaboration with external attorneys when needed.
•	Review important legal vendor and supplier contracts to ensure compliance and protect the company's interests.
•	Lead contract negotiations with both prospects and vendors, ensuring favorable terms and minimizing risks.
•	Stay updated on developments and implementation of relevant new legislation and case law around contract law.
•	Maintain and update customer contract templates, including Master Service Agreements (MSA), Terms and Conditions (T&Cs), and order forms.
•	Oversee all commercial legal matters and provide advice to the CFO accordingly.
•	Develop a long-term legal, risk, and compliance strategy in collaboration with the CFO, covering areas such as operations, commercial activities, corporate governance, and employment.
•	Provide advice and counsel on data protection and privacy legal matters, including implementation.
•	Measure and optimize output metrics, such as response time for requests, sales team and employee satisfaction with customer and vendor contracting.
•	Minimize external legal fees
•	Minimize deals lost in the contracting phase due to negotiations.
profile_positions.title: Head of Legal

profile_positions.description:
High quality legal research and drafting provided to law firms and companies. Some past and present clients include:
o Lightstream Technologies (Canada) – drafted, negotiated and vetted: Global Exclusive Distribution Agreement, Terms and Conditions of Sale of Product, License and Distribution Agreement, Financing Agreement, Use of Location Agreement, Marketing and Video Production Agreement, Profit Sharing Agreement, Release of Liability Form, Rental Agreement,
Sales Commission Agreement, Waiver and Release
o Ironflow Technologies (Canada) – prepared a 400-page memo on leave policies for employees in the USA and Canada.
o Sarah Holmes Law (U.S.) – provided paralegal services for Sarah Holmes Law, named Superlawyer for 2020 in Business Law. Provided vetting/drafting services of: Subscription Agreement, Stock Purchase Agreement, Loan Agreement, Asset Purchase Agreement, Service Agreement for data compilation and licensing. Further, drafted several legal opinions i.e. validity of assignment clause under Pennsylvania and New Jersey law; new PPP and EIDL guidelines due to Covid-19, validity of non-compete clause for 1099 contractors under Pennsylvanian law.
o Extreme Energy (PK) – Drafted Partnership Agreement and Business Agreement
o Elevate Technologies – vetted and provided legal advice on Dealer Agreement for promotion/sale of Mobile Services.
o Black Ink Business Services (U.S.) – provided comprehensive report on employer requirements
o Independent Client – Vetted IT Services Management Agreement
profile_positions.title: Legal Consultant

profile_positions.description:
- Worked through the entire contract lifecycle process from drafting, redlining, negotiating, execution and archival that govern the sale and purchase of IT products and/or services i.e. Master Product Purchase Agreements, Master Service Purchase Agreements, Non-Disclosure Agreements.  This included customer facing and vendor facing Agreements. 
- Reviewed terms and conditions in bid documents and manufacturer/publisher agreements. 
- Worked as a key member in the U.S. legal team, where I reported to the Senior Legal Counsel and engaged the Vice President of Legal for necessary approvals.  Furthermore, liaised with stakeholders such as sales, business and finance to gain the necessary approvals in the contract or terms.
profile_positions.title: Contracts Attorney

profile_positions.description:
- My duties included assisting the Partners in matters related to the labour, commercial and corporate sector of Pakistan as well as the labour sector of Afghanistan. In assisting the Partners, I would conduct legal research, draft legal opinions, legal research and a variety of legal contracts.

- Specifically vetted and drafted: employment agreements, NDA's, consultancy agreements, distribution agreements, partnership agreements, HR Policies and HR Manual's. 

- Advised major companies in Afghanistan on legal and corporate compliance.  In addition to providing labour law related opinions, I further advised clients on how to register companies in Afghanistan as well as to their income tax liabilities. 

- Provided legal advice and drafted legal opinions for international organisations in Pakistan pertaining to their labour law requirements. This included, for example, closure of a provident fund plan as well as the obligation to provide medical insurance to local employees. 

- Drafted legal notices on behalf of clients specifically in relation to property law i.e. breach of lease agreement. 

- Prepared numerous responses for RFP's (Request for Proposal) in order to secure clients for the firm.
profile_positions.title: Legal Associate

profile_positions.description:
- My duties included drafting writ petitions ; researching case law and points of law. Legal areas I have worked in include corporate and industrial relations matters.

- I completed my 6 month training during this time period and was enrolled as an Advocate in the Islamabad Bar Council.
profile_positions.title: Legal Trainee

profile_positions.description:
- During my time here, I had various responsibilities which included: accompanying the seniors at the firm to the High Court/District Court and adjourning the cases, if necessary; preparing drafts for parawise comments; drafting and revising contracts; conducting research; meeting and advising clients.

- Advised international organisations in complying with employment laws in Pakistan; drafted employment agreements and staff rules
profile_positions.title: Junior Associate

profile_positions.description: A learning opportunity where I was able to gain knowledge about the various aspects on international law though watching videos and reading. Alongside knowledge gained on international law, I also wrote reports and articles which furthered my understanding.
profile_positions.title: Intern

profile_positions.description: My duties included research work on a various number of human rights issues in relation to Pakistan as well as the law applicable to them.
profile_positions.title: Legal Intern
